The clinical spectrum of COVID‐19 appears to be wide, encompassing asymptomatic infection, mild upper respiratory tract illness and severe viral pneumonia with respiratory failure, systemic inflammatory syndrome and even death.
2 The respiratory tract is the primary target for SARS‐CoV‐2 virus, however cardiovascular involvement has been documented in different studies and the heart is involved in 40% of patients dying from COVID‐19 disease.
